arts.ttl: Reading boss calls on focus to be on 'outstanding' performance in Rotherham victory
arts.sum: Reading manager Noel Hunt spoke highly of match-winner Harvey Knibbs following a dramatic last-gasp penalty to beat Rotherham United 2-1. Now the club's leading scorer, Knibbs had netted midway through the first half but the Millers responded through Sam Nombe. Pulled down in the box by former Royal Zak Jules, Knibbs stepped up himself and sent Dillon Phillips the wrong way to snatch a dramatic winner. "He has been brilliant," Hunt said after the match. "Even with all the noise around him in January, he’s been a class act. He is in and around the penalty area for the first goal and obviously talking about the boys being brave and putting crosses into dangerous areas, Sav was brilliant and put some brilliant ball in.

arts.ttl: Harvey Knibbs nets stoppage time winner as Reading overcome dogged Rotherham United
arts.sum: Reading scored a stoppage time penalty to overcome a dogged Rotherham United side 2-1 at the SCL Stadium. Harvey Knibbs netted in each half while the Millers saw two goals ruled out for offside and scored a second-half penalty of their own through Sam Nombe. Noel Hunt and Co. demanded more of the side following Tuesday’s lacklustre draw with Shrewsbury Town, and his side certainly delivered. The better side right from the off, the Royals peppered Dillon Phillips’ goal and played with much more energy and tempo than they had done against the Shrews.

arts.ttl: Play-off chasing Reading beat Rotherham after late Harvey Knibbs penalty
arts.sum: Knibbs struck in the fourth minute of stoppage time to leave the Royals one point off the top six.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Noel Hunt opts to name unchanged side for Rotherham United test
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt has named an unchanged squad for the visit of Rotherham United. The Royals are unbeaten in three but many were left disappointed with the team's display in Tuesday's 1-1 draw with Shrewsbury Town. Joel Pereira remains between the posts after saving a penalty against the Shrews in midweek. Michael Craig; Tyler Bindon; Amadou Mbengue and Andre Garcia are looking for a second clean sheet in a week after Saturday's stalemate at Huddersfield Town.

arts.ttl: Live updates: Reading look to return to winning ways with Rotherham United visit
arts.sum: Reading are looking to make it four matches unbeaten and return to winning ways as Steve Evans brings his Rotherham United side to Berkshire. Dropping points on Tuesday in a 1-1 draw with lowly Shrewsbury Town, an out-of-form Millers outfit are the next in line.

arts.ttl: Reading to kick off 2025/26 season early due to summer World Cup in North America
arts.sum: The English Football League have confirmed that the Championship, League One and League Two will start earlier than in previous years. This season, the Royals travelled to heavy-spending Birmingham City on Saturday, August 10 for their opening fixture, holding Blues to a 1-1 draw at St Andrew's. However, this time around, League One and League Two will kick-off on the weekend of August 2 and August 3. The second tier is to follow on August 10, a week later.

arts.ttl: Reading boss calling on players to 'embrace' direct battle expected from Rotherham
arts.sum: Noel Hunt is calling on his players to 'embrace' the 'direct' style that Steve Evans' Rotherham United will bring to the SCL Stadium on Saturday. Unbeaten in their last three, drawing two, the Royals sit just two points outside the play-offs while the Millers languish in the bottom half. Among the pre-season favourites for promotion under the vastly-experienced boss, the Millers came from behind the beat Ruben Selles' Royals 2-1 at the New York Stadium in September. Drawing at Blackpool and losing to Shrewsbury on Saturday, who Reading drew 1-1 with on Tuesday, Hunt is expecting another physical battle on the weekend.

arts.ttl: How Scott McTominay and girlfriend Cam Reading have 'fallen in love' with Italy: Dining on the Amalfi Coast, becoming a fan-favourite with Diego Maradona tribute - and language lessons from Antonio Conte!
arts.sum: So quickly has Scott McTominay won over Napoli fans that, for some supporters, he has already attained greater icon status than the famous Neapolitan pizza.

arts.ttl: 'Something wasn't right': Former Reading midfielder on Dai Yongge and 'chaotic' exit
arts.sum: Former Reading midfielder Dave Edwards explained that 'something wasn't right at the top' even during his time at the club. A Shrewsbury Town and Wolverhampton Wanderers legend, Edwards made 35 appearances for the Royals between 2017 and 2019. The sixth signing of the Dai Yongge era, with the businessman taking over at the end of 2016/17, the Wales international arrived at the start of the fall from grace which the club are still suffering from. While sanctions, late wages and overall crises did not kick in until after Edwards had left, the combative midfielder explained that even in the early days, before points deductions, fan protests and pitch invasions, 'something wasn't right.'

arts.ttl: Reading set for top 10 finish but miss out on play-offs, according to SuperComputer
arts.sum: Reading are tipped to miss out on the play-offs by six points according to latest Super Computer predictions. Noel Hunt's side are unbeaten in three but the mood among supporters appears disappointed, especially after Tuesday's lacklustre 1-1 draw with relegation-threatened Shrewsbury Town. In the midst of a run of three straight home matches, the Royals sit ninth and only two points off the top six as we enter the final few months of the campaign.
